favourite.article: Thank you for this wonderful combination of Music and Text with Piano and Guitar notes! God Bless You people!!
Use to sing this at bush hill park methodist church when we were little in sunday school.

Thank You Jesus the lover of my soul, Alpha and Omega, You are worthy to be praised. In all generation there is no one like Jesus!!! Yes Jesus Loves Me And I Love Him Too. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!

My mother was taking my 3 year old daughter, Kelsey by the hand going for a walk. They heard a Robin cheerfully singing in a tree above them. Mom asked Kelsey, "What do you think that Robin is singing", Thinking for a few moments She responded by breaking into this Chorus; "Yes Jesus Loves me"...
This song has comforted me since I was 4 years old.
Thank you for the song, Jesus.
Loved this song as a child, but as an adult it means a whole lot more. "My first love"
I love Jesus.

This song was written by Anna Bartlett Warner (1820-1915) in 1860. The chorus and tune were added by William Batchelder Bradbury in 1862 - Wikipedia. ------------------------------------------ Anna Warner and her sister, Susan, grew up near West Point Military Academy, where they became known for leading Sunday school services for the young men there. After the death of their father, a New York lawyer, the sisters supported themselves with their various literary endeavors. Susan became a best-selling novelist. Anna also wrote novels and published 2 collections of poems. She wrote this simple hymn in 1860 to be included in one of her sister's novels. In the story, it was a poem of comfort spoken to a dying child. ... Once when asked to summarize the essential truths of the Christian faith, the great Swiss theologian Karl Barth gave this simple answer: "Jesus loves me, this I know, for the Bible tells me so." - Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton ----------------------------------- Betty 7/2012 gives the additional original stanzas. Marilee 1/2013 gives more stanzas which were added later. There is another original stanza that is usually omitted, probably because it fit the specific context of the novel it was written for but not general situations. But it is touching especially when the context is considered: ------------------------- Jesus loves me—loves me still, Though I'm very weak and ill; From his shining throne on high, Comes to watch me where I lie. ----------------------------- In 1943 in the Solomon Islands, John F. Kennedy's PT-109 was rammed and sunk. Islanders Biuku Gasa and Eroni Kumana who found Kennedy and the survivors remember that when they rode on PT boats to retrieve the survivors, the Marines sang this song with the natives, who had learned it from Seventh-day Adventist missionaries - Wikipedia

Here are all the verses...
Jesus loves me! This I know, For the Bible tells me so; Little ones to Him belong; They are weak, but He is strong.
Refrain: Yes, Jesus loves me! Yes, Jesus loves me! Yes, Jesus loves me! The Bible tells me so.
Jesus loves me! This I know, As He loved so long ago, Taking children on His knee, Saying, “Let them come to Me.”
Jesus loves me still today, Walking with me on my way, Wanting as a friend to give Light and love to all who live.
Jesus loves me! He who died Heaven’s gate to open wide; He will wash away my sin, Let His little child come in.
Jesus loves me! He will stay Close beside me all the way; Thou hast bled and died for me, I will henceforth live for Thee.

I too learned this as a child; I am 71 years old and still love to sing it. I love this verse too:
Luke 18:16 (KJV) But Jesus called them unto him, and said, Suffer little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
Here are two more verses from my hymn book.
Jesus loves me! He Who died, Heaven's gate to open wide; He will wash away my sin, Let His little child come in.
Jesus loves me! He will stay Close beside me all the way; Thou hast bled and died for me, I will henceforth live for Thee.
My mother taught me this song as soon as I could utter my first words, and to this day, in times of great stress, it is the song that I sing.
I love this song.
I just love this old song. my parents taught it to me when I was a small child and I am now an adult, (almost 60) & I still enjoy singing this song.
I have to memorize this song when about twelve years old in my country church. Now I love this song day by day. So I'm weak but He is strong. Amen!

It reminds me of the good old days when I was in primary school in my village. We used to sing this song and it is still in my memory. I am happy to find it online and to sing it again and sing it for my children too.

When I sing this song it makes my feel good inside. When I carried my one and only child I sang this song all the time rubbing my belly. Now she is 6 years old and I still sing this hymn to her. She said mommy you always sing this song, sing a different song. But I know she likes it because she always falls asleep. The Holy Spirit is the best Comfortor that God has given to man. Thank You, Jesus!

My mother sang this to me when I was a little girl, and she still does - and I'm now 41! I sing it to my little girl who is 7 1/2 yrs old. Thank you so much for this incredible website! I can't wait to teach my daughter so many old hymnals and allow it to breathe peace into my soul. My 78 yr old mother misses the hymnals from her youth, and this is a wonderful opportunity for her, thank you! ;-)
It is a delight to find this song on the web. I was taught that song when I was 2 y.o., and sung it in church with the choir. I'm now 65 y.o., and that song is still in my spirit. Thank you!
I love this song. Finding the music online means that even with my terrible singing voice I can try and sing as part of my prayer time! Thank you so much for putting it freely online.
I really love this song since when I was young and until now I have taught this to my kids. How God loves us.
I love this song so so so much. Now I am introducing this song to my little angel. Thank the Lord for all Your blessings.
I love this song. It is a kid song but I still sing it.

Thanks be to God, I am the Lord's daughter. This song was taught to me as a very young little girl. I still sing it, and now I have a second stanza that I have not sung before. Thank You Lord for loving me. I am Yours and You are mine.
Some say this is a children's song but it can still be for adults.
Praise the Lord! For God loves us! We must love Him also because He is the reason we are here!
We will follow Him, encourage the parents, and love the children. Yes, Jesus loves me. We give Him all the praise.
